skill.name: subagent-driven-development
skill.description: Use when executing implementation plans with independent tasks in the current session
skill.summary: Use when executing implementation plans with independent tasks in the current session
skill.author: Cycleaddict

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. Contains only markdown files defining workflow methodology. No scripts, network access, filesystem operations, or command execution capabilities.

content.value_statement: Implement complex projects by dispatching subagents for independent tasks. Each task gets two-stage review ensuring spec compliance and code quality. Stay in the same session for fast iteration.
actual_capabilities: Dispatch implementer subagents for each independent task
Two-stage review workflow: spec compliance then code quality
Review loops until issues are resolved
Final comprehensive review after all tasks complete
limitations: Best for independent tasks (not tightly coupled work)
Must stay in same session (no parallel sessions)
More subagent invocations than manual execution

use_cases.title: Feature implementation
use_cases.description: Break down features into independent tasks and execute with quality gates at each step

use_cases.title: Multi-file refactoring
use_cases.description: Safely refactor large codebases by dispatching isolated subagents with review checkpoints

use_cases.title: Codebase auditing
use_cases.description: Review implementations against specifications with automated compliance checking

prompt_templates.title: Implement task
prompt_templates.prompt: Use implementer-prompt.md to dispatch an implementer subagent with full task text and context

prompt_templates.title: Check spec compliance
prompt_templates.prompt: Use spec-reviewer-prompt.md to review whether implementation built what was requested

prompt_templates.title: Review code quality
prompt_templates.scenario: Assess code quality after spec compliance
prompt_templates.prompt: Use code-quality-reviewer-prompt.md to verify clean, tested, maintainable code

prompt_templates.title: Final review
prompt_templates.scenario: Review entire implementation after all tasks
prompt_templates.prompt: Dispatch final code reviewer for complete implementation assessment

output_examples.input: Implement the authentication feature using subagent-driven development. Plan is in docs/plans/auth-feature.md
output: Creating TodoWrite with 5 tasks from plan
Dispatching implementer subagent for Task 1: User login endpoint

best_practices: Provide full task text to subagents (do not make them read files)
Answer subagent questions before they proceed with implementation
Never skip review loops when issues are found
Keep subagents in same session to avoid context switching
anti_patterns: Making subagents read the plan file instead of providing full text
Skipping spec compliance review before code quality review
Proceeding to next task while reviews have open issues

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Uses the Task tool to dispatch subagents.

faq.question: How many subagent invocations per task?
faq.answer: Three: one implementer plus two reviewers (spec and code quality). More thorough than single-pass approaches.

faq.question: How does this integrate with other skills?
faq.answer: Use with writing-plans for plan creation and finishing-a-development-branch for final cleanup.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: This is a prompt-only skill. It processes data within your current session and makes no external calls.

faq.question: What if a subagent fails or asks questions?
faq.answer: Answer questions clearly and completely. If subagent fails, dispatch a new fix subagent with specific instructions.

faq.question: How is this different from executing-plans skill?
faq.answer: Executing-plans uses parallel sessions. Subagent-driven stays in same session for continuous progress without handoffs.
